TextJPN: ……見慣れた天井。
TextENG: ...I saw a ceiling I was familiar with.

TextJPN: …はっきりしない意識の中だが、自分がいつもの朝のように布団の中にいるのだけはわかった。
TextENG: ...Though I was groggy from sleep, I did notice that I was in my futon, like I was every morning.

TextJPN: 時計を見ると、…あんなにも遅くに床に就いたにも拘らず、いつもの目を覚ます時間ぴったりだった。
TextENG: I looked at my clock... and despite having turned in so late last night, I had awoken at precisely the same moment I always did.

TextJPN: これだけ寝不足でも…、毎日の決められた時間に起きられるものなのか。
TextENG: I'm so low on sleep... but I guess you really can get up at the same time every day.

TextJPN: ……人体の神秘に驚くと言うか、呆れるほかない…。
TextENG: ...The secrets of the human body never ceased to amaze me...

TextJPN: このまま寝直せば、絶対に目を覚まさないだろう。@k……自らの体に鞭打って、布団を抜け出す。
TextENG: If I went back to sleep like this, I would definitely not be waking up again.@k ...I spurred myself on and slipped out of my futon.

TextJPN: 朝食の場でお袋に昨夜のことを聞かれた。
TextENG: Mom asked me about last night at breakfast.

TextJPN: ……うちにも梨花ちゃんたちの所在を尋ねる電話が来たらしく、お袋もただならぬ事態をうすうす理解しているようだった。
TextENG: ......Apparently we, too, had gotten a call asking if we knew where Rika-chan and Satoko were, and Mom vaguely understood that something serious was happening.

TextJPN: 「…じゃあ、昨夜はお友達とみんなで、夜遅くまで捜してたの？」
TextENG: ``...So then, you were out late last night with all your friends looking for them?``

TextJPN: 「……結局、見つかったの？@k@vS02/00/132700028.　その、梨花ちゃんと沙都子ちゃんは」
TextENG: ``...Did you find them?@k@vS02/00/132700028. Rika-chan and Satoko-chan, I mean.``

TextJPN: シャク。
TextENG: Crunch.

TextJPN: …………味気なくトーストを噛む。@k…本当に味なんかしなかった。
TextENG: ......I wearily bit into my toast.@k ...It really didn't have any taste.

TextJPN: その時、ぴんぽーんというチャイムの音が聞こえてきた。
TextENG: Just then, we heard the chime go ding-dong.

TextJPN: 時計を見上げると、レナとの待ち合わせ時間を５分くらい過ぎたところだった。@k……レナだ。
TextENG: I looked up at the clock and saw that it was about five minutes past my regular meeting time with Rena.@k ...It was her at the door.
``...Good morning.@k@vS02/02/130200282. ...Did you get any sleep? Did you?``

TextJPN: 「…何時間寝れたんだろな。@k@vS02/01/130100749.多分、ニワトリの足でも数えられるくらいだと思う」
TextENG: ``...I think I slept for a few hours...@k@vS02/01/130100749. You could probably count them on a chicken's toes, though.``

TextJPN: 「あはははは」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha.``

TextJPN: レナもやはり寝不足のようだ。@k…いつもの元気が、少し足りなかった。
TextENG: Rena seemed pretty sleep-deprived as well.@k ...There was something missing from her usual spirit.

TextJPN: 「……学校、…行くか？」
TextENG: ``...Are you... going to school?``

TextJPN: 「うん…。@k@vS02/02/130200285.……その方がね、きっといいと思うの」
TextENG: ``Yeah...@k@vS02/02/130200285. ......I think it would be better that way.``

TextJPN: 硬いながらも笑顔で、そう言った。
TextENG: She said, smiling, albeit stiffly.

TextJPN: …レナだってあの２人のことが心配で心配でたまらないはずなのだ。
TextENG: ...Rena was probably worrying her heart out about those two as well.

TextJPN: …だけど学校へ行こうという。
TextENG: ...Even so, she wanted to go to school.

TextJPN: 「……今日をお休みしたら、きっと圭一くんは病んで病んで、寝込んじゃうと思う。@k@vS02/02/130200287.…私、そんなの嫌だから。@k@vS02/02/130200288.…だから一緒に学校に行こ」
TextENG: ``...If you stay home today, I think you'd just be worrying non-stop and sleeping.@k@vS02/02/130200287. ...I don't want that.@k@vS02/02/130200288. ...So let's go to school together.``
``.........All right.@k@vS02/01/130100752. Wait just a moment.@k@vS02/01/130100753. I'll get ready.``

TextJPN: レナの精一杯の気配りが、…ほんの少しだけうれしかった。
TextENG: I was... just a little bit happy about Rena mustering that much consideration for me.

TextJPN: 魅音との待ち合わせ場所に来たが、魅音の姿はなかった。
TextENG: We went to the place where we'd usually meet up with Mion, but she was nowhere to be found.

TextJPN: …今日は少し遅れ気味なくらいだから、先に待ってると思っていたのだが…。
TextENG: ...We were a little bit late today, so we thought she'd be waiting for us...

TextJPN: 「……魅ぃちゃん、さすがに今日は起きられないかもね」
TextENG: ``...I guess Mii-chan couldn't wake up today, huh?``

TextJPN: 「あ、…そうか。@k@vS02/01/130100755.……あいつにとっては昨日だけじゃないんだよな。@k@vS02/01/130100756.…一昨日の晩も、村長さんを捜して徹夜してるんだよな…」
TextENG: ``Ah... that's right.@k@vS02/01/130100755. ...For her, it wasn't just yesterday.@k@vS02/01/130100756. ...She was up all night looking for the mayor the night before last, too...``

TextJPN: ほんのしばらく待った。@k…もう行ってもいい時間になり、二人して顔を見合わせる。
TextENG: We waited for a bit.@k ...Time passed until it got to the point where it was okay for us to go on alone, and we exchanged glances.
``What do we do...?@k@vS02/01/130100758. Wait a little longer?``

TextJPN: その時、ようやく朝の空気で起き出してきた脳が、…昨夜、大石さんに言われた不吉な言葉を思い出させる。
TextENG: At that point, my brain, which had finally been woken up by the morning air... recalled the ominous words Ooishi-san had left me with last night.

TextJPN: ……御三家の当主が次々と消えている。@k…次は…園崎家の当主が消えるかもしれない。
TextENG: ......The leaders of the Three Families were disappearing one after the other.@k ...And next... it might be the Sonozaki's leader.

TextJPN: まさか魅音、……………………そんなはずは……。
TextENG: Could Mion have............ No, that couldn't be...

TextJPN: 「………行こ。@k@vS02/02/130200291.今日は寝かせておいてあげようよ」
TextENG: ``......Let's go.@k@vS02/02/130200291. Let's let her sleep for today.``

TextJPN: レナが軽く背中を叩く。
TextENG: Rena gave me a pat on the back.

TextJPN: 「……魅音、……本当にいるよな」
TextENG: ``...Mion... ...She's still here, right?``
``Hm?@k@vS02/02/130200293. Did you say something?``
``Oh... nothing, just talking to myself.@k@vS02/01/130100761. ...Let's get moving.``

TextJPN: 俺たちは２人だけで学校へ向かう。
TextENG: The two of us headed to school by ourselves.

TextJPN: 途中で、親と一緒に登校するクラスメイトを何人も見かけた。
TextENG: On the way, we saw a bunch of our classmates accompanied by their parents.

TextJPN: …車で学校まで送ってもらっているクラスメイトもいるみたいだ。
TextENG: ...It even looked like some of them were being taken to school by car.

TextJPN: 校門にはなんと、校長先生が立ち番をしていた。@k初めてみる光景だ。
TextENG: Surprisingly, the principal was also standing watch at the school gate.@k I'd never seen that before.

TextJPN: 「おはようございます」
TextENG: ``Good morning.``

TextJPN: 「おはようございます」
TextENG: ``Good morning.``

TextJPN: 保護者たちに頭を下げる校長。@k…その脇に立てかけられた木刀が、何だか不気味だった。
TextENG: The principal was bowing to our classmates' guardians.@k ...The wooden sword leaning next to him was a little ominous.

TextJPN: 「前原君、おはよう。@k@vS02/00/133200003.竜宮君、おはよう」
TextENG: ``Maebara-kun, good morning.@k@vS02/00/133200003. Ryuugu-kun, good morning.``

TextJPN: 「…お、おはようございます」
TextENG: ``...G-Good morning.``

TextJPN: 「先生から大切なお話があるから、すぐに教室に入るように。@k@vS02/00/133200005.…いいかね」
TextENG: ``Your teacher has something important to say, so head straight to the classroom.@k@vS02/00/133200005. ...All right?``

TextJPN: 俺もレナも、何も言わなかった。
TextENG: Rena and I said nothing.

TextJPN: ………夜だけの狂気が、ついに日の下にも滲み出してきた…。@k…そんな感じだった。
TextENG: ......The madness that only existed at night had finally crawled out into the sunlight...@k ...That's what it felt like.

TextJPN: 「皆さん、おはようございます」
TextENG: ``Good morning everyone.``

TextJPN: ついさっきまで蔓延していたヒソヒソ話は、先生が来た途端にウソのように掻き消えた。@k……シンとした静寂のみが支配する。
TextENG: The hushed conversations that had been spreading for a while now all disappeared like an illusion the moment our teacher walked in the door.@k ...Silence dominated the classroom.

TextJPN: 先生と一緒に校長先生までもが入ってくる。@k……明らかに普通ではない朝だった。
TextENG: The principal came in with our teacher as well.@k ...This was clearly not a normal morning.

TextJPN: 「…まず、校長先生から大切なお話があります。@k@vS02/22/131400017.…校長先生、どうぞ」
TextENG: ``...First, the principal has something important to tell everyone.@k@vS02/22/131400017. ...Go ahead, Mr. Principal.``

TextJPN: 咳払いをしてから、校長が壇上に上がった。
TextENG: The principal cleared his throat and approached the dais.

TextJPN: 「………もう知っている生徒もおるだろう」
TextENG: ``......I'm sure some of you already know this.``

TextJPN: ……シンとした教室。
TextENG: ...The classroom was dead silent.

TextJPN: ……梨花ちゃんと沙都子の、空いた席にみんなの視線が注がれていた。
TextENG: ...Everyone was staring at Rika-chan and Satoko's empty seats.

TextJPN: 校長は短く簡素に、…梨花ちゃんと沙都子が行方不明になったことを告げた。
TextENG: The principal briefly and simply declared... that Rika-chan and Satoko had gone missing.

TextJPN: …知らない者は教室には誰一人いなかった。@k……だが、それを事実として受け入れられない者は、……かなりいるようだった。
TextENG: ...There wasn't a single person in the classroom who didn't already know.@k ...There seemed to be many, however... who couldn't accept it as the truth.

TextJPN: それが、校長の言葉により、事実として認識されたのだ。
TextENG: It had been confirmed to them now by the principal's words.

TextJPN: ……教室のあちこちからすすり泣く声、…嗚咽が聞こえだす。
TextENG: ...There were sobs throughout the classroom... and I heard a kid crying.

TextJPN: …それらは少しずつ教室全体に染み渡っていった…。
TextENG: ...They steadily spread throughout the whole room...

TextJPN: …豪放な校長も、いたたまれない様子だった。
TextENG: ...The big-hearted principal wasn't able to keep his cool, either.

TextJPN: 「はい、皆さん、注目注目！@k@vS02/22/131400019.　今日から当分の間、登下校は保護者の方と一緒に行ないます。@k@vS02/22/131400020.保護者の方の都合が付き難い生徒は集団での登下校とします」
TextENG: ``Okay, everyone, pay attention!@k@vS02/22/131400019. From today on, your parents or guardians will be taking you to school.@k@vS02/22/131400020. For those of you whose parents can't do so, you'll be coming here in groups.

TextJPN: 「プリントを作りましたのでよく読み、保護者の方にも必ず見せて下さい。@k@vS02/22/131400022.いいですね！」
TextENG: I made a handout, so read it carefully, and be sure to show it to your parents.@k@vS02/22/131400022. Understand?``

TextJPN: 先生の口調もどこか角があった。
TextENG: The teacher's voice was a little abrasive.

TextJPN: ……先生だって、未曾有の異常事態に緊張を隠せないのだ…。
TextENG: ...Not even she could conceal the strain she felt from this unprecedented, abnormal situation...

TextJPN: いっそ休校にすればいいのにと思った。
TextENG: They should have just cancelled school today.

TextJPN: だがレナに言わせると、学校は両親が共働きしている生徒の託児所のような一面もあるので、休校を望まない保護者もいるとのことだった。
TextENG: However, Rena told me that the school was also like a nursery for the students whose parents both worked, so some of them wouldn't want school to be cancelled.
``Well then, let's begin the lesson.@k@vS02/22/131400024. ...Class president... she's absent, I see.@k@vS02/22/131400025. Then whoever is on day duty, let me hear it!``

TextJPN: 「きりーーーーつ、」
TextENG: ``All rise!``

TextJPN: こんな狂った日常になってしまったからこそ、学校という空間だけでもいつもの日常を保とうという気持ちには、……今だけは賛成だった。
TextENG: That feeling of wanting to maintain an everyday atmosphere, even if only in school, precisely because our lives had been messed up... was something that I agreed with at this point.

TextJPN: いつもは職員室でお昼を取る先生も、今日は教室で食事をしていた。
TextENG: As for the teacher, who always had her lunch in the staff lounge, she ate in the classroom today.

TextJPN: ……噂どおりのカレー弁当に苦笑するが、共に笑ってくれるクラスメイトはいなかった。
TextENG: ......I had to laugh at her curry bento—which was just a rumor until now—but there was nobody to laugh with me.

TextJPN: レナが自分のイスと弁当箱を持って俺の席へやって来る。
TextENG: Rena brought her chair and lunch over to my seat.

TextJPN: …今日は…仲間は俺たち２人しかいないのだ。@k…机を寄せる必要がないことが…悲しかった。
TextENG: ...Today... it was only the two of us.@k ...The fact that we didn't need to drag any other desks over... was sad.

TextJPN: 「…眠いね」
TextENG: ``...I'm sleepy.``

TextJPN: 「…あぁ。@k@vS02/01/130100763.…でも、もうそんなに気にならなくなったよ。@k@vS02/01/130100764.…むしろ、今、寝れるくらいの図太い神経がうらやましい」
TextENG: ``...Yeah.@k@vS02/01/130100763. ...I don't feel like sleeping anymore, though.@k@vS02/01/130100764. ...In fact, I'm jealous of the people that could sleep at a time like this. They've got nerves of steel.``

TextJPN: 「あははは、そうかもね」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha, you're right.``

TextJPN: 朝こそ眠かったが、…登校してからずっと張り詰めている緊張の空気で、すっかり眠気は散ってしまった。
TextENG: I was sleepy this morning... but my drowsiness had dissipated after coming to school and constantly feeling the incredible tension.

TextJPN: レナの弁当箱にはいつもの精彩がない。
TextENG: Rena's bento box didn't have its usual luster.

TextJPN: …当然だ。
TextENG: ...That was to be expected.

TextJPN: 昨夜はレナだって相当遅くまで起きていた。
TextENG: Rena was up for a long time last night, too.

TextJPN: …弁当の下準備をする時間なんかなかったのだろう。@k朝、早く起きられたわけでもなかったろうし…。
TextENG: ...She wouldn't have had time to make her lunch beforehand.@k Since it's not like she would have gotten up early this morning...

TextJPN: 「…遠慮なく突っつけよ。@k@vS02/01/130100766.今日は素直に俺の弁当の方が立派なのを認めろ」
TextENG: ``...Grab anything you want.@k@vS02/01/130100766. Go ahead, you can admit that my bento is better today.``

TextJPN: 「じゃ、じゃあ…遠慮なく頂くね。@k@vS02/02/130200298.…わ、しそチーズのちくわ巻きなんて面白いな」
TextENG: ``O-Okay... then I'll have some.@k@vS02/02/130200298. ...Wow, a chikuwa roll with perilla and cheese? That's interesting.``

TextJPN: 「レナのだって、今日のはレトルトだろうけどなかなかうまいぞ」
TextENG: ``Rena, yours might have ready-made food in it, but it's pretty good too.``

TextJPN: ……互いに、少しでもいつものお昼の雰囲気を盛り上げようと必死になっているのがわかった。
TextENG: ...I realized the two of us were desperately trying to brighten the afternoon mood to its usual level as much as we could.

TextJPN: ……教室を見渡すと、…そんな努力をしているのは俺たちだけで、周りは相変わらず暗い雰囲気そのままだった。
TextENG: ...I looked around the classroom... and it seemed like we were the only ones trying to do so, surrounded as we were by gloominess.

TextJPN: 「……うふふ！@k@vS02/02/130200300.　こうして２人だけでお弁当を突っつき合ってると…何だか…、その、…………何だかだよね！　…はぅ～」
TextENG: ``......Ufufu!@k@vS02/02/130200300. Just the two of us sharing our lunches like this... It's sort of... well... .........sort of like something! ...Hau~``

TextJPN: 「ははは、……はは……」
TextENG: ``Hahaha... haha...``

TextJPN: 俺たちの笑い声が…小さくなる。@k…先につまづいたのは俺だった…。
TextENG: Our laughter... grew quieter.@k ...I was the first one to mess up...
``Sorry.@k@vS02/01/130100771. ...I mean... well, I'm sorry.``
``......No, it's okay.@k@vS02/02/130200302. ...It's not your fault.``

TextJPN: 二人して…、…箸が止まる。@k……これ以上はもう無理だった。
TextENG: Our chopsticks... both stopped moving.@k ...We couldn't keep it up any more.

TextJPN: 「……梨花ちゃんと沙都子、……どこに行ったんだろうな」
TextENG: ``...Rika-chan, Satoko... I wonder where they went.``

TextJPN: あまりに惨い言葉だったかもしれない。
TextENG: Those words might have sounded too miserable.

TextJPN: …誰もが思いつつも、遠回しに言っていた言葉を…あまりに直接に言ってしまった。@kレナが息を呑むのがわかる…。
TextENG: ...Everyone was thinking it, using roundabout ways to address the topic... but I came right out and said it.@k I heard Rena catch her breath...

TextJPN: 「………………昨日ね、圭一くんがいなくなってる間にいろいろと話を聞いてたから、…レナの知ってる限りを話すね」
TextENG: ``............Yesterday, while you were gone, I heard a bunch of things... so I'll tell you what I know, okay?``
``.........Sorry again about last night.@k@vS02/01/130100774. ...Go ahead.``

TextJPN: レナは俺がいなくなっている間、応援に来た婦人会の人たちと一緒に味噌汁の炊き出しを手伝っていた。
TextENG: At that time, since they had arrived for support, Rena was helping the ladies' society cook the miso soup we'd had.

TextJPN: 村人たちが集めてきた情報が逐一報告されてきたので、レナはそれを聞いていたのだと言う。
TextENG: They reported all of the information the villagers had gathered, and Rena said she overheard it.

TextJPN: 「……でも、結局何もわからなかったんだろ？@k@vS02/01/130100776.　学校が終わってから家に帰って、２人で自転車に乗ってどこかへ行ったらしいということ以外はまったく…」
TextENG: ``...They didn't know anything important, though, did they?@k@vS02/01/130100776. Rika-chan and Satoko went home after school, and then apparently went somewhere on their bikes, but other than that...``

TextJPN: 昨日、魅音もそう言っていた。@k…手がかりは皆無だと。
TextENG: Mion had told me yesterday.@k ...We had no clues.

TextJPN: 「…うん。@k@vS02/02/130200305.……警察の人も、家に帰ってからすぐに自転車で遊びに行ったんだろうって言ってる」
TextENG: ``...Yeah.@k@vS02/02/130200305. ...The police also said that they probably went out on their bikes to go play somewhere as soon as they got home.``

TextJPN: 「…家に帰ってからすぐに自転車で遊びに行くところといったら、…町かもしれないでしょ」
TextENG: ``...If they were going out to play somewhere on their bikes right after getting home... then they might have gone into town.``

TextJPN: 「……だから、興宮の町でいなくなったんじゃないかって結論になってるみたい。@k@vS02/02/130200308.警察は明るくなってから捜査範囲を興宮にも広げるって言ってた」
TextENG: ``...So I guess they concluded they disappeared while in Okinomiya.@k@vS02/02/130200308. The police were saying how they were going to expand their search to Okinomiya in the morning.``

TextJPN: 町でか…。
TextENG: In town...

TextJPN: ……それなら、雛見沢中を捜しても見つからないのには納得がいく。
TextENG: ......It'd make sense why we couldn't find them even though we searched all of Hinamizawa, then.

TextJPN: …でも…違和感がある。
TextENG: ...Still... something didn't fit.

TextJPN: ……理由はないが、…何となくだ。
TextENG: ......I had no basis for thinking that... just a gut feeling.

TextJPN: 俺はあの日、恐らくとても重要なことを梨花ちゃんに打ち明けた。
TextENG: I revealed something to Rika-chan that was likely very important to her that day.

TextJPN: …梨花ちゃんはそれに対して、自分に任せろと言った。@k…それから…えぇと、何て言ったっけ…。
TextENG: ...Then, Rika-chan had told me to leave it to her.@k ...And then... err, what did she say...

TextJPN: そうそう、自分が頑張らないと、犬さんも大変なことになってしまうと言ったような気がする。
TextENG: Oh, right—if she didn't work hard, then something bad might happen to the dog, too. I think.

TextJPN: 犬だの猫だの、……言葉の真意は今となってはさっぱりわからないが…、…梨花ちゃんなりに、一刻を争う表現だったように思う。
TextENG: With all the talk of dogs and cats... I still didn't have the faintest idea what she really meant, but... it might have been Rika-chan's way of saying this was a race against time.
...Damn it!!!

TextJPN: あの時の俺は…不安なことを梨花ちゃんに一方的に押し付けて…逃げようとしてしまった！
TextENG: I'd selfishly pushed my anxiety on Rika-chan... and tried to run away!

TextJPN: よく考えれば…あの場は逃げるべきじゃない。@k犬や猫の話を…もっともっと詳しく聞くべきだったんだ。
TextENG: When I thought about it... I shouldn't have run back then.@k I should have asked her more... about the dogs and cats.

TextJPN: …思い出せば思い出すほど…何たる失態ッ！！
TextENG: ...The more I think back on it... I really screwed up!!

TextJPN: ……とにかく、…梨花ちゃんはとてものんびりと遊びに行けるような状態ではなかったと思うのだ。
TextENG: ...Anyway... I don't think Rika-chan was in a situation where she would just go off to play somewhere.

TextJPN: ……もちろん、証拠も確信に足りる根拠もない。@kただの勘だ。
TextENG: ...Of course, I didn't have any evidence or conviction to base that on.@k It was just a hunch.

TextJPN: 「……………町なんかに、…行くわけないと思うんだ」
TextENG: ``.........I don't think... I don't think she'd go into town.``

TextJPN: 「圭一くんもそう思う？@k@vS02/02/130200310.　レナもそう思うよ。@k@vS02/02/130200311.梨花ちゃんも沙都子ちゃんも、雛見沢でいなくなったに違いないの」
TextENG: ``You think so too, Keiichi-kun?@k@vS02/02/130200310. I agree.@k@vS02/02/130200311. Rika-chan and Satoko-chan must have disappeared in Hinamizawa.``

TextJPN: ぎょっとしてレナに振り返る。
TextENG: I looked back at Rena, startled.

TextJPN: …今のレナの言葉には確信めいた響きが含まれていたからだ。
TextENG: ...I could hear the conviction in those words.

TextJPN: レナは応えず、弁当箱を持って廊下へ向かった。
TextENG: Without replying to my gaze, she took her bento box and went to the hallway.

TextJPN: 「…お弁当箱を洗ってくるね」
TextENG: ``...I'm going to go rinse this out.``

TextJPN: 話を打ち切るようなタイミング。
TextENG: She timed that in a way that broke off the conversation.

TextJPN: …咄嗟に、教室では話しにくい内容なのではないかと直感する。
TextENG: ...Suddenly, I got the feeling that the next thing she had to say would be hard to say aloud in the classroom.

TextJPN: 俺も慌てて弁当箱を持ち、レナの後を追う。
TextENG: I hurriedly grabbed my bento box and followed her.

TextJPN: …レナは給湯室ではなく、あまり生徒の来ない裏の水飲み場へ向かって行った。
TextENG: ...Rena didn't go to the kitchenette, but rather to the water fountains out back, where students seldom went.

TextJPN: …じょぼじょぼと弁当箱を洗う。
TextENG: ...The water flowed down onto our bento boxes.

TextJPN: …その間、レナは一言もしゃべらなかった。
TextENG: ...During that time, Rena didn't say a word.

TextJPN: そして、他の生徒の気配がないことを確認してから、ようやく口を開いた。
TextENG: Then, after making sure there were no other students around, she finally opened her mouth to speak.

TextJPN: 「…梨花ちゃんと沙都子ちゃんが町に遊びに行っていなくなったなんて、@k@vS02/02/130200313.なんだか腑に落ちなくて………私なりにいろいろ、聞いたり、調べたりしたの」
TextENG: ``...The whole thing about Rika-chan and Satoko-chan going to town to play and then disappearing...@k@vS02/02/130200313. that didn't make sense for some reason...... so I decided to investigate a little bit myself.``
``...Who did you ask?@k@vS02/01/130100780. What did you ask them about?``

TextJPN: 「婦人会のおばさんたちにいろいろ。@k@vS02/02/130200315.……昨日のお味噌汁、お豆腐がいっぱい入ってたでしょ。@k@vS02/02/130200316.…富田豆腐店のお婆ちゃんも来てたの」
TextENG: ``I asked the ladies' society all kinds of things.@k@vS02/02/130200315. ...There was a lot of tofu in the miso soup yesterday, remember?@k@vS02/02/130200316. ...The old lady from the Tomita Tofu shop came, too.``

TextJPN: ……富田豆腐店。
TextENG: ......The Tomita Tofu shop...

TextJPN: …あぁ思い出した。
TextENG: ...Oh, I remember.

TextJPN: 病院へ行く道の途中にある商店の並びのひとつだ。
TextENG: That was one of the stores on the road leading to the hospital.

TextJPN: 風呂桶みたいな水槽の中に踊る、でっかい豆腐の塊がいつも涼しそうだった。
TextENG: Those huge lumps of tofu dancing in the bathtub-like cistern always looked nice and refreshing.

TextJPN: 「お婆ちゃんね、昨日、学校の帰り道に沙都子ちゃんがお店に寄って、お豆腐を買っていったのを覚えてたの」
TextENG: ``The old lady says she remembers Satoko-chan stopping to buy tofu there on her way home from school.``

TextJPN: 「……豆腐？@k@vS02/01/130100782.　学校の帰り道にだろ？@k@vS02/01/130100783.　それが何か手がかりになるのか？」
TextENG: ``...Tofu?@k@vS02/01/130100782. Well, it's on the way home, right?@k@vS02/01/130100783. How is that a clue?``

TextJPN: 「いいから聞いて。@k@vS02/02/130200319.…梨花ちゃんの家に行った時のこと、覚えてるかな？」
TextENG: ``Just listen!@k@vS02/02/130200319. ...Do you remember when we went to Rika-chan's house?``

TextJPN: レナが水飲み場から離れ、梨花ちゃんの部屋を再現するように、両手を広げて空間を再現してみせた。
TextENG: Rena stepped away from the sinks and spread her arms wide to recreate the space of Rika-chan's room.

TextJPN: 「……ガス台にお鍋がかけてあって、その中にお味噌汁が入ってたの。@k@vS02/02/130200321.中にはお豆腐が多分、一丁の半分くらい入ってたと思う。@k@vS02/02/130200322.残りの半分は冷蔵庫の中にあったの」
TextENG: ``......There was a pot on her gas cooker, and there was miso soup in it.@k@vS02/02/130200321. I think there was probably about half of it inside.@k@vS02/02/130200322. The rest was in the refrigerator.``

TextJPN: 「冷やっこにするつもりだったんだね。@k@vS02/02/130200324.お皿に開けてラップがかけてあった」
TextENG: ``They must have been planning to make chilled tofu.@k@vS02/02/130200324. It was on a plate in plastic wrap.``

TextJPN: そう言いながら、まるでそこに梨花ちゃんの部屋があるように、歩き回りながら説明する。
TextENG: As Rena explained, she walked around, as if she were really going through Rika-chan's room.

TextJPN: 「でもレナ、…それが何だって言うんだ」
TextENG: ``Still, Rena... why does this matter?``

TextJPN: 「圭一くん。@k@vS02/02/130200326.お味噌汁のお豆腐って、本当に最後の最後に入れるんだよ」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun.@k@vS02/02/130200326. When you make miso soup, you put the tofu in last.``

TextJPN: 「つまり、お料理してた梨花ちゃんかもしくは沙都子ちゃんは、お夕飯の時間の直前まであそこに立って料理をしていたことになるの」
TextENG: ``That means that Rika-chan, or Satoko-chan, whoever was cooking, was standing there making it up until right before dinnertime.``

TextJPN: 「夕食の時間の…直前まで…？！」
TextENG: ``Right up until... dinnertime...?!``

TextJPN: 確か…昨日は、２人の自転車が見当たらないから、２人してどこかへ遊びに行ったに違いないという事になったんじゃなかったっけ…？！
TextENG: Wasn't everyone saying... that their bikes weren't around, so they must have gone somewhere to play by themselves...?!

TextJPN: 「三角コーナーのゴミを見たら、すごくぶきっちょだった。@k@vS02/02/130200329.…食事やお弁当はほとんど梨花ちゃんが作ってるんだけど、たまにね、沙都子ちゃんがすることもあるの。@k@vS02/02/130200330.だからその晩は沙都子ちゃんがお料理したんだね」
TextENG: ``The trash in the countertop bin was put in there really awkwardly, too.@k@vS02/02/130200329. ...Rika-chan makes most of their food and lunches, but occasionally Satoko-chan does it too.@k@vS02/02/130200330. So Satoko-chan was cooking that night.``

TextJPN: 「……それってつまり、……沙都子に関しては、遊びに行かず、…夕食の準備をしてたってことなのか…？！」
TextENG: ``...So that means... ...that Satoko, at least, didn't go somewhere to play... She was preparing dinner...?!``

TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS02/02/130200332.それで私、炊飯釜も見てみたの。@k@vS02/02/130200333.…炊飯釜には２人分のご飯が炊けていた」
TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS02/02/130200332. Then I took a look at the rice cooker, and...@k@vS02/02/130200333. ...there was rice for two still in there.``

TextJPN: 「……ってことは、２人分の夕飯は作ったけど、２人とも夕飯は食べなかった。@k@vS02/01/130100788.…そういうことか？」
TextENG: ``...So she made dinner for both of them, but neither of them ate it.@k@vS02/01/130100788. ...Is that it?``

TextJPN: レナが頷く。
TextENG: Rena nodded.

TextJPN: 「それで次に冷蔵庫の中も見てみたの。@k@vS02/02/130200335.そうしたら、残り半分のお豆腐で作った冷やっこがあったの。@k@vS02/02/130200336.それだけじゃない。@k@vS02/02/130200337.お夕飯用に作ったおかずも何皿かあって、それらにはみんなラップがされていた」
TextENG: ``So next I looked in the fridge.@k@vS02/02/130200335. There was some chilled tofu, made from the other half that they bought.@k@vS02/02/130200336. That's not all, either.@k@vS02/02/130200337. There were a whole bunch of plates with side dishes for dinner, and all of them were in plastic wrap.``

TextJPN: ……残り物を翌日に取っておく時なんかに、よくラップをするよな。
TextENG: ...You usually plastic wrap things so that you can have leftovers for the next day.

TextJPN: …うちのお袋もよくそうして、朝飯にしたり弁当のおかずにしたりしている。
TextENG: ...My mom does it all the time, too, using them in breakfast or lunch.

TextJPN: 「そう。@k@vS02/02/130200339.ラップって、食べ残しとかを取っておくためにするものだよね。@k@vS02/02/130200340.……冷蔵庫に入れたということは、少なくともその晩の内には食べないつもりだったということ」
TextENG: ``That's right.@k@vS02/02/130200339. You use plastic wrap to save leftovers for later.@k@vS02/02/130200340. ...So the fact that they were in the fridge means that they didn't plan on eating them that night, at least.``

TextJPN: 「………えっと……そういうことになるのか…？」
TextENG: ``...Umm... ...Is that what it means...?``

TextJPN: 「圭一くん。@k@vS02/02/130200342.もっとよく考えて。@k@vS02/02/130200343.…お夕飯をまったく手付けずでラップしてあったんだよ？@k@vS02/02/130200344.　どういうことだと思う？」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun.@k@vS02/02/130200342. Think a little harder.@k@vS02/02/130200343. ...Their dinner was totally untouched and wrapped up.@k@vS02/02/130200344. What do you think that means?``

TextJPN: 「……えっと…じゃあ、……夕食を食べる必要がなくなったわけだ。@k@vS02/01/130100791.…外食とか、出前とかで」
TextENG: ``......Umm... ...Well... ...That means they didn't need to eat dinner anymore.@k@vS02/01/130100791. ...So they would have gone out to eat, or ordered takeout.``

TextJPN: 「それも突然にね。@k@vS02/02/130200346.前もって決まっていたらお料理なんかしない。@k@vS02/02/130200347.…そして、お夕食は２人分用意されていた」
TextENG: ``It must have been really sudden, too.@k@vS02/02/130200346. If they had decided to do that beforehand, they wouldn't have made anything, but...@k@vS02/02/130200347. ...there was dinner for the two of them.

TextJPN: 「つまり、沙都子ちゃんは、２人で食事が出来ると、本当に直前までそう思って料理をしていたということなの」
TextENG: That means that when Satoko-chan was making their dinner, they really thought they were going to eat it until right before they didn't.``

TextJPN: 「……じゃ、じゃあ……、２人で遊びに行っていなくなったというのは…間違いじゃないか…！！」
TextENG: ``...So, then... the theory about the two of them going out to play and then disappearing... is wrong..!!``

TextJPN: 「そう。@k@vS02/02/130200350.…つまり、いなくなったのはお夕飯が出来て、夕食に至るまでの本当にわずかな時間。@k@vS02/02/130200351.…多分、７時頃くらい」
TextENG: ``Yep.@k@vS02/02/130200350. ...They disappeared after making dinner, and right before they ate it.@k@vS02/02/130200351. ...Probably around seven o'clock.``

TextJPN: 「………そんな時間に、食事もせずに２人はどこへ行ったんだ…」
TextENG: ``......Where would they have gone at a time like that by themselves without eating...?``

TextJPN: 「当然、そこに行き着くよね。@k@vS02/02/130200353.…圭一くん、覚えてるかな？@k@vS02/02/130200354.　折り畳み机が置いてあって、その上にお醤油や箸立てなんかが置いてあったのを」
TextENG: ``That's obviously where this is leading.@k@vS02/02/130200353. ...Keiichi-kun, do you remember?@k@vS02/02/130200354. On their foldout table, there were things like soy sauce and a chopstick holder.``

TextJPN: …そんなのもあったかもしれない。@k…覚えてない。
TextENG: ...There might have been something like that.@k ...I didn't remember.

TextJPN: 「お醤油の小瓶ね。@k@vS02/02/130200356.空っぽだったの。@k@vS02/02/130200357.もう一滴も入ってなかった。@k@vS02/02/130200358.これじゃあ冷やっこは美味しくないよね。@k@vS02/02/130200359.だから私、流しの下にある醤油の大瓶を探してみたの」
TextENG: ``The container for the soy sauce...@k@vS02/02/130200356. it was empty.@k@vS02/02/130200357. There wasn't even a drop left.@k@vS02/02/130200358. Chilled tofu wouldn't taste good without it.@k@vS02/02/130200359. So I looked under their sink for the larger bottle of soy sauce they have.``

TextJPN: 「…よくそんなところにあるって知ってるな」
TextENG: ``...You sure know a lot about where they keep stuff.``

TextJPN: 「あははは、私も梨花ちゃんの家に行ってお料理したことあったから」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha, I've been to Rika-chan's house and cooked for them before.``

TextJPN: レナは咳払いをしてからまた真面目な表情に戻る。
TextENG: Rena cleared her throat, her face returning to a serious expression.

TextJPN: 「でね、流しの下を開けてみたら、醤油の大瓶が瓶ごとなかったの」
TextENG: ``Then when I opened the cabinet, the big bottle of soy sauce wasn't there at all.``

TextJPN: 「……醤油の大瓶がない…と、どういう意味になるんだ…？」
TextENG: ``...It wasn't there... Wh-What does that mean...?``

TextJPN: 「ここから先は全部、レナの想像だからね。@k@vS02/02/130200363.……だから最後まで口を挟まずに聞いていてね」
TextENG: ``Everything I'm going to say from here on is just Rena's idea.@k@vS02/02/130200363. ......So please listen until the end without saying anything.``

TextJPN: …昨日の夜。
TextENG: ...Last night.

TextJPN: 沙都子はいつものように夕食の準備をしていた。
TextENG: Satoko was making dinner like normal.

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんは食事ができるまでテレビを見ているのが普通だそうだから、きっとごろんと横になりながらバラエティ番組でも見ていたのだろう。
TextENG: Rika-chan usually watched TV until the food was ready, so she was probably lying down watching a variety show or something.

TextJPN: 味噌汁に豆腐を入れ、もうすぐ夕食というところで、醤油が切れていることに気がついた。
TextENG: Satoko put the tofu in the miso soup, and right when dinner was about to be ready, she noticed that they were out of soy sauce.

TextJPN: そこで手の空いている梨花ちゃんが、醤油の大瓶を持って、ご近所に醤油を分けてもらいに行ったのではないか。
TextENG: So Rika-chan, who had nothing to do, brought the big bottle of soy sauce to a neighbor's house to borrow theirs.

TextJPN: 「…俺、ご近所付き合いってよくわからないんだが、…醤油なんかって分けてもらえるものなのか？」
TextENG: ``...I don't really know my neighbors that well... Would people be willing to just give her soy sauce?``

TextJPN: 「うん。雛見沢ではそんなに珍しいことじゃないよ」
TextENG: ``Yeah. It's not all that uncommon in Hinamizawa.``

TextJPN: そして梨花ちゃんは、自転車に乗って醤油を分けてもらいに出掛けた。
TextENG: So Rika-chan rode her bike out to get some soy sauce.

TextJPN: だが、いつまで経っても梨花ちゃんが帰ってこない。
TextENG: No matter how long Satoko-chan waited, though, Rika-chan didn't come back.

TextJPN: そこで沙都子は、梨花ちゃんが醤油を分けてもらいに行った家へ電話をかけた。
TextENG: So then Satoko-chan called up the house where Rika-chan was going.

TextJPN: …うちの梨花がお邪魔してませんこと？@k　こんな感じだろう。
TextENG: ...Would Rika happen to be imposing on you?@k Something like that.

TextJPN: 相手は、きっとこんな感じで返事をしたに違いない。
TextENG: Then the other person must have replied with something like this.

TextJPN: 「…うちに食事の用意があるから、沙都子ちゃんもいらっしゃい。@k@vS02/02/130200365.梨花ちゃんはもう食べてるよって。@k@vS02/02/130200366.…きっとそんな感じで呼び出したんだと思う」
TextENG: ``'...We have plenty of food here, so you should come too, Satoko-chan.@k@vS02/02/130200365. Rika-chan has already eaten.'@k@vS02/02/130200366. ...I think that's how they called her out there.``

TextJPN: 沙都子は悪態をつきながら、自分の作った夕飯にラップをかけた。
TextENG: Satoko called Rika a few names in private and wrapped up the dinner she had made for them.

TextJPN: 冷蔵庫に入れたのは明日の朝食や弁当のおかずに流用するためだ。
TextENG: She put it in the fridge so she could use it for breakfast and lunch the next day.

TextJPN: そして沙都子も自転車に乗った。@k梨花ちゃんのいる家に向かって。
TextENG: Then Satoko got on her bike too...@k and headed for the house where Rika-chan was.

TextJPN: 「でも、…すでにこの時点でおかしいの。@k@vS02/02/130200368.食事ってね、突然やってきた人に振舞えるほど、多めに作るものじゃないんだよ」
TextENG: ``Okay, but... this is already pretty strange.@k@vS02/02/130200368. You don't normally make so much food that you can give it to people who suddenly arrived at your house.``

TextJPN: 百戦錬磨の主婦が、２人分も余るくらいに食事を作りすぎるなんて、普通じゃ考えられない。
TextENG: A veteran housewife would never normally make so much food that she could feed two extra people.

TextJPN: 「…たまたま、偶然作りすぎたことだって考えられるだろ…？」
TextENG: ``...Could it have just been a coincidence that they made too much...?``

TextJPN: 「それでも、絶対に考えられない」
TextENG: ``It's still unthinkable.``

TextJPN: レナはきっぱりと一蹴した。
TextENG: Rena flatly denied me.

TextJPN: 「だって、…梨花ちゃんは、沙都子ちゃんががんばって作ったお夕飯がもう出来てることを知ってるんだよ？！@k@vS02/02/130200371.　どんなにお夕飯を勧められたって、沙都子ちゃんのお夕飯を無駄にするようなことをするわけがない」
TextENG: ``Since... Rika-chan knew that Satoko-chan had worked really hard to make dinner for them, didn't she?!@k@vS02/02/130200371. No matter what kind of food she was offered, she wouldn't let Satoko-chan's dinner go to waste.``

TextJPN: ……状況証拠とレナの想像だけ。
TextENG: ...This was all only circumstantial evidence and Rena's guesswork.

TextJPN: …だがその説得力は…あまりにも力強かった。
TextENG: ...Even so, it was all... extremely convincing.

TextJPN: 今の、手がかりが一切ないこの状況を打破できる唯一の光明だったからだ。
TextENG: It was the only ray of hope we had to topple this situation bereft of clues.

TextJPN: 「……じゃあレナ。@k@vS02/01/130100801.…梨花ちゃんは…どこへ醤油をもらいに行ったんだ？！」
TextENG: ``...Then, Rena.@k@vS02/01/130100801. ...Where did Rika-chan go... to get soy sauce?!``

TextJPN: それこそが核心…！！
TextENG: That was the heart of it...!!

TextJPN: 醤油をもらいに行くくらい心安くて、…沙都子が食事に招待されても不審に思わない。@k……それは誰だッ？！
TextENG: It would have to be somewhere she'd be comfortable with asking for soy sauce... and somewhere Satoko wouldn't think it suspicious that she'd been invited for dinner.@k ...So, who was it?!

TextJPN: レナはゆるく首を横に振った…。
TextENG: Rena slowly shook her head...

TextJPN: 「………レナの推理はここまで。@k@vS02/02/130200373.…あくまでも想像だからね。@k@vS02/02/130200374.警察の人とかには内緒にしておいてね」
TextENG: ``......That's all for Rena's guesses.@k@vS02/02/130200373. ...These are all just ideas, okay?@k@vS02/02/130200374. Keep them a secret from the police.``

TextJPN: 「隠すことはないんじゃないか…？@k@vS02/01/130100803.　仮に半分しか合ってないとしても、きっとヒントにはなると思うぞ…」
TextENG: ``What is there to hide...?@k@vS02/01/130100803. Even if only half of what you say is right, it should be a good clue for all this...``

TextJPN: 「圭一くん。@k@vS02/02/130200376.……これって雛見沢の人を疑うって意味だよ。@k@vS02/02/130200377.…確信もないのに村の人を疑えない」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun.@k@vS02/02/130200376. ...This all means suspecting someone from Hinamizawa.@k@vS02/02/130200377. ...We can't suspect anyone without a really good reason.``

TextJPN: 何人かの女の子たちが弁当箱を洗いにこっちへ来るのが見えた。
TextENG: I saw a few girls coming over to rinse out their bento boxes.

TextJPN: …レナはそれで話を打ち切り、教室へ戻っていった…。
TextENG: ...Rena cut the conversation short there and returned to the classroom.

TextJPN: 俺はひとり残り、賑やかなセミの声に身を浸してみた…。
TextENG: I stayed there alone, my body bathed in the lively voices of the cicadas...

TextJPN: …整理してみよう。
TextENG: ...Let's think about this.

TextJPN: …俺なりに。
TextENG: ...In my own way.

TextJPN: …あれしか情報のないレナが、あれだけの推理をしてみせたのだ。
TextENG: ...Rena had barely any information to go on, and yet she'd reasoned out that much.

TextJPN: ……なら、レナよりもはるかに多くのことを知る俺にしかできない推理があるはずだ…。
TextENG: ...So there should be something that only I, who knew far more than Rena did, could deduce...

TextJPN: 昨夜、大石さんも言っていたが、この事件は間違いなく雛見沢の内側で起こっていることだ。
TextENG: Ooishi-san said this last night too, but this incident was definitely occurring within Hinamizawa.

TextJPN: ……レナは信じたくないだろうが、犯人は雛見沢の誰かだとほぼ確実に決まっている。
TextENG: ...Rena might not have wanted to believe it, but it's basically a given that the culprit is someone from the village.

TextJPN: まず事の発端は、俺たち４人が禁忌の祭具殿に忍び込んだことから始まった。
TextENG: The trigger for everything was when the four of us trespassed in the forbidden storehouse.

TextJPN: そして、その祭具殿への侵入は何者かに見られていた。
TextENG: Somebody saw us going in there.

TextJPN: 犯人たちにとって、祭具殿の禁忌を犯すことは、万死に値することだった。
TextENG: For the culprits, breaking the taboo was a crime punishable by death.

TextJPN: ……そしてその晩の内に、富竹さんと鷹野さんは犠牲になった。
TextENG: ...So that night, Tomitake-san and Takano-san were sacrificed.

TextJPN: 残るは２人。
TextENG: There were two left.

TextJPN: …俺と詩音。
TextENG: ...Shion and myself.

TextJPN: だが、犯人たちの牙は俺と詩音に向く前に、…まず、詩音が打ち明けた村長に向けられた。
TextENG: However, before the culprits bore their fangs on Shion and me... they went after the mayor, to whom Shion had confessed her sin.

TextJPN: そして、次の牙は…俺が打ち明けた梨花ちゃんに…。@k…じゃあ沙都子は？@k　…とばっちりか…？
TextENG: Next... they went for Rika-chan, to whom I'd confessed my sin...@k ...Then what about Satoko?@k ...Just a stray bullet...?

TextJPN: 打ち明けられて犠牲になった梨花ちゃんも悔しいが、@k…訳もわからずに犠牲になった沙都子は…さぞや無念だったろう…。
TextENG: By itself, Rika-chan being sacrificed after I'd told her everything was mortifying...@k but Satoko, who was sacrificed for no reason... wasn't that all the more regrettable?

TextJPN: ……全て…俺のせい…！！
TextENG: ...Everything... was my fault...!!

TextJPN: 次に消えるのは誰だろう。
TextENG: Who would be the next to disappear?

TextJPN: 今度こそ…俺と詩音なのか…？
TextENG: Would it be... Shion and me next time...?

TextJPN: …だが…どうして犯人たちは、俺と詩音へはさっさと手を下さないのだろう。
TextENG: ...Why... Why weren't the culprits going for Shion and me right away, though?

TextJPN: 村長や梨花ちゃんたちを消すほどの行動力があるならば、どうして俺と詩音をさっさと消さないのだろう。
TextENG: If they had enough power to erase the mayor and Rika-chan, then why not just get rid of Shion and me?

TextJPN: 俺や詩音を襲うなら、…嫌な話ではあるが、まだ許せる。
TextENG: If they went for us... well, I wouldn't like it, but I could still tolerate it.

TextJPN: ……許せないのは、打ち明けられた人間を消す点だ。
TextENG: ......What I couldn't forgive was them getting rid of those we'd confessed to.

TextJPN: …そう言えば、@k…昨日、詩音が、誰かに監視されている気がする、なんて物騒なことを言っていた気がする。
TextENG: ...Now that I think of it...@k ...yesterday, Shion said something alarming—she felt like someone was watching her.

TextJPN: ………じゃあ、…俺も誰かに監視されている…？
TextENG: ......So then... was someone watching me as well...?

TextJPN: だが…不思議と今日までそう感じることはなかった。
TextENG: Strangely, though... I hadn't felt anything like that until now.

TextJPN: …自らが元凶でありながらも、今日までそういう印象を抱いたことはない。
TextENG: ...Even though I'm the root cause of everything, I had never once had that impression.

TextJPN: それは単に、俺が詩音よりも注意力が散漫で、無用心なだけかもしれないのだが。
TextENG: Maybe that was simply because Shion was more cautious than me, and I was just careless.

TextJPN: ………話が脱線した。@k…戻そう。
TextENG: ......That's another story, though.@k ...Let's get back on track.

TextJPN: 犯人たちが、なぜ俺や詩音を襲わないのか。
TextENG: Why weren't the culprits going after Shion and me?

TextJPN: ……ここにカギがあるような気がする。
TextENG: ......I felt like that's where the key to this lay.

TextJPN: …ひょっとして……、何か大前提が間違っているのだろうか…？
TextENG: ...Could it be... Was I making a big assumption that I shouldn't have been...?

TextJPN: …………………………いくら考えても答えは出ない。
TextENG: ............I thought and thought, but couldn't come up with an answer.

TextJPN: ただひとつ、わかることは、@k…俺はこの事件の当事者で、@k…全てが解決するまで見守る義務があるということだけだ。
TextENG: The one thing I understood...@k was that I was a concerned party to this case...@k and that I had a duty to watch over it until everything got resolved.

TextJPN: 昼休みの終わりを告げる振鈴の音が聞こえてくる……。
TextENG: I heard the ring of the bell declaring the end of lunch break...

TextJPN: 今夜も誰か消えるのだろうか。
TextENG: Would somebody else disappear tonight?

TextJPN: ……もしも誰かが消えなければならないのなら。@k…今夜こそ俺を消してほしい。@k…そして全てを終わりにしてほしい。
TextENG: ...If nobody else did...@k then I wanted them to get rid of me tonight for sure...@k ...and then put an end to all of this.

TextJPN: 脳裏に昨夜の電話で叫んだ、詩音のヒステリックな声が蘇る。
TextENG: Shion's hysterical voice on the phone last night came back to mind.

TextJPN: …親しい者から順に殺していって、さんざん悲しい思いをさせてから殺すつもり…。
TextENG: ...They planned to murder those close to us first, make us as miserable as possible, and only then would they kill us...

TextJPN: 「前原くん、昼休みは終わりであるぞ。@k@vS02/00/133200008.教室に戻りなさい」
TextENG: ``Maebara-kun, lunch break is over.@k@vS02/00/133200008. Go back to the classroom.``

TextJPN: 校長先生に促され、俺はお通夜のように静かな教室に戻っていった…。
TextENG: At the principal's urging, I returned to the classroom, which was quiet as the streets at night...

TextJPN: 下校時間には、たくさんの保護者が迎えに来ていた。@k…さながら幼稚園のようだった。
TextENG: There were a lot of parents picking up their children after school.@k ...It was just like a kindergarten.

TextJPN: 親の来ない生徒は集団下校。
TextENG: The students whose parents didn't come went home as a group.

TextJPN: 決められた順路に従い、みんなで下校する。
TextENG: We left school with everyone else, following the assigned route.

TextJPN: 下校中も、みんなは面白おかしいおしゃべりなどしなかった。
TextENG: Even while leaving, nobody said anything funny.

TextJPN: ……まるで黙々と山中を歩く、疲れ切った登山者みたいだった。
TextENG: ...They all looked like exhausted mountaineers silently marching through the mountains.

TextJPN: ……そうして、ひとり、またひとりといなくなり、最後には俺とレナだけになった。
TextENG: ...As we went, one left, and then another, and in the end it was just Rena and me.

TextJPN: レナを自宅まで送っていくことになっていたが、レナはそれを辞退すると言った。
TextENG: I was supposed to escort Rena all the way to her house, but she declined.

TextJPN: 「…本当にいいのか？@k@vS02/01/130100805.　ひとりじゃ無用心だぞ…」
TextENG: ``...Will you be all right?@k@vS02/01/130100805. It's not safe to go alone...``

TextJPN: 「レナを送った後、ひとりで帰る圭一くんだって同じくらい無用心だよ。@k@vS02/02/130200379.…まだ明るいんだもの。@k@vS02/02/130200380.大丈夫」
TextENG: ``It would be just as dangerous for you to go home by yourself after bringing me back, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS02/02/130200379. ...It's still light out anyway.@k@vS02/02/130200380. I'll be fine.``
``I see.@k@vS02/01/130100807. ...Then be careful, okay?``

TextJPN: レナが俺の家の方を指差す。
TextENG: Rena pointed towards my house.

TextJPN: …家の前に車が停めてあった。
TextENG: ...There was a car stopped in front of it.

TextJPN: そこから降りてきたのは大石さんだった。@k……俺の帰宅を待ち伏せていたに違いない。
TextENG: From out of that car came Ooishi-san.@k ...He must have been waiting for my return to ambush me.

TextJPN: 嫌らしくにやにやと笑いながらこちらにやってくる。
TextENG: Ooishi-san started walking over wearing that annoying grin.

TextJPN: 「…レナはもう行きな。@k@vS02/01/130100809.あいつに絡まれると長い」
TextENG: ``...Rena, you should go.@k@vS02/01/130100809. If you get involved with him, you'll be here for hours.``

TextJPN: 「で、でも、どうして警察の人が圭一くんに用があるんだろ。…だろ」
TextENG: ``B-But, what do the police want with you? ...With you?``

TextJPN: ……………レナはいいヤツだと思った。
TextENG: ............Rena's a good person.

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんの失踪を騒ぎ出した時にも、俺になぜとは聞かなかった。
TextENG: Even when I made a fuss over Rika-chan's disappearance, she never asked me why I did.

TextJPN: …あの時点から、レナは俺を疑ってもよかったのだ。
TextENG: ...She could have been suspecting me ever since then, and that would have been okay.

TextJPN: でも、今日までレナはあえて聞かないでくれた。@k……俺が打ち明けるまで、急かさないでくれた。
TextENG: Even so, she still hadn't asked me anything.@k ...She didn't try and pressure me into revealing the truth.

TextJPN: 「…………俺は犯人じゃない」
TextENG: ``......I'm not the culprit.``

TextJPN: 「そんなの知ってるよ」
TextENG: ``I know that.``

TextJPN: 「…………でも、……事件に、……何の関わりもないとは…言い切れない」
TextENG: ``......That said... I can't say... that I'm totally uninvolved... with this incident.``

TextJPN: レナはいつもの笑顔で聞いてくれた。
TextENG: Rena simply listened, smiling like she always did.

TextJPN: …事件への関係を臭わせる俺にも、汚いものを見るような目を向けなかった。
TextENG: ...Even though I had insinuated I was related to the incident, she didn't look at me as though she were looking at something dirty.

TextJPN: 「……今度、話すよ」
TextENG: ``...I'll tell you next time.``
``Okay.@k@vS02/02/130200388. ...I'm looking forward to it.``

TextJPN: 「…じゃ、早く行きな」
TextENG: ``...Get going, then.``

TextJPN: レナは会釈してから小走りで駆けて行った。
TextENG: Rena gave me a slight bow and trotted away.

TextJPN: …残される俺。@kその眼前にやってくる大石さん。
TextENG: ...Leaving me...@k alone with Ooishi-san, who walked over.

TextJPN: 「どうもどうも。@k@vS02/11/130700214.お帰りなさい。前原さん」
TextENG: ``Hello, hello.@k@vS02/11/130700214. Welcome home, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 「……どうも」
「ご家族はお留守みたいですねぇ。@k@vS02/11/130700216.いやはや、困っていたんですよ」
TextENG: ``It looks like your parents aren't here.@k@vS02/11/130700216. My my, was I in a bit of a spot.``

TextJPN: …家にまで来たのか…。@k…両親不在の幸運に感謝するしかない。
TextENG: ...He came all the way to my house...?@k ...I could only thank my good fortune that my parents were absent.

TextJPN: …この時間に２人揃っていないということは、きっと帰りは遅くなるだろう。
TextENG: ...Since neither of them was around at this hour, they would probably be back late.

TextJPN: 「…親父の仕事の関係で出掛けてるんだと思います。@k@vS02/01/130100815.帰りは遅いと思いますよ」
TextENG: ``...I think Dad got called out on business.@k@vS02/01/130100815. I don't think he'll be back until later.``

TextJPN: 「そうですか。@k@vS02/11/130700218.それはそれは好都合です。@k@vS02/11/130700219.…親御さんに変な思いをさせずに済みます」
TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS02/11/130700218. Well, that's convenient, I suppose.@k@vS02/11/130700219. ...We can do this without giving your parents any strange ideas.``

TextJPN: 大石さんが俺の背中を押し、歩くよう促す。@k…どうも自分の車に乗せる気のようだった。
TextENG: Ooishi-san pushed my back, prompting me to walk.@k ...It seemed like he wanted me to get in the car.

TextJPN: 「……警察に連行するんですか」
TextENG: ``...Are you taking me to the police station?``

TextJPN: …俺は犯人じゃないが、……全ての元凶だ。
TextENG: ...I wasn't the culprit... but I was the cause of everything.

TextJPN: 取調べられてもおかしくない。
TextENG: It wouldn't be weird if he wanted to investigate me.

TextJPN: そういう意味ではある種の諦めに似た感情もあった…。
TextENG: That kind of gave me a resigned feeling...

TextJPN: 「いえいえ、立ち話も何ですから、車の中でお話しようってだけですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700221.さぁさ、どうぞどうぞ」
TextENG: ``No, no, I just don't want to stand around talking—we can just talk in the car, that's all.@k@vS02/11/130700221. Come now, don't be shy.``

TextJPN: 後部座席を開け、入るように勧める。
TextENG: He opened the back door and urged me inside.

TextJPN: ……これに乗ってしまったら、簡単には解放されないだろう。
TextENG: ...If I got in, I wouldn't have a very easy time getting out.

TextJPN: …だが、……嫌だと言えばこの男のこと、本当に手錠をかけて連れて行くかもしれない。
TextENG: ...If I said no, however... then this man might really handcuff me and take me away.

TextJPN: ……断っても駄目なら、潔くするしかなかった。
TextENG: ...I couldn't refuse—I could only accept in good grace.

TextJPN: 車内は効き過ぎたクーラーと、あまり掃除をしていないフィルターのかび臭い匂いで満ちていた。
TextENG: The inside of the car had been cooled too much by the air conditioner, and there was a rusty smell coming from the filter, which must have been cleaned only rarely.

TextJPN: 「ありゃ、冷えすぎます？@k@vS02/11/130700223.　切りましょうか」
TextENG: ``Oh, is it too cold?@k@vS02/11/130700223. I'll turn the car off.``

TextJPN: エンジンを切ると、急に静かになり、涼しさと寂しさを持ったヒグラシの声が忍び込んできた。
TextENG: He turned off the engine and it suddenly became quiet—and the voices of the higurashi, with all their cool loneliness, snuck inside.

TextJPN: ……カナカナカナカナカナ。
TextENG: ......Kwakwakwakwakwakwakwa.

TextJPN: それは、自分の浅はかな好奇心が招いてしまった、あまりに大きすぎる代償を嘆く声の合唱に聞こえた。
TextENG: It sounded to me like a chorus of voices, lamenting my exorbitant punishment for having harbored such foolish curiosity.

TextJPN: しばらくの間、……その声を聞きながら、俺もまた、あの晩から狂い始めてしまった日々を…嘆く。
TextENG: For a few moments... while listening to those voices, I myself lamented... the days that had been twisted and distorted since that night.

TextJPN: 大石さんも、俺が自発的に話すのを待っているつもりなのか、タバコに火をつけ、ひぐらしの声に耳を傾けている…。
TextENG: Ooishi-san, as if waiting for me to voluntarily begin talking, lit a cigarette and listened to the higurashi...

TextJPN: 沈黙が耳に痛くなり…先に折れたのは俺の方だった。
TextENG: The silence became deafening... and I was the one who folded first.

TextJPN: 「……捜査の方はどうなってるんですか」
TextENG: ``...How is the investigation going?``

TextJPN: 「捜査？@k@vS02/11/130700225.　何のですか？@k@vS02/11/130700226.　最近はいっぱいあり過ぎて、どれのことやら。んっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``The investigation?@k@vS02/11/130700225. Of what?@k@vS02/11/130700226. There've been so many. Which do you mean? Nfu-fu!``

TextJPN: 「全部です」
TextENG: ``All of them.``

TextJPN: 「……いいですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700228.本当は報道管制の敷かれた秘密捜査なんですが、あなたには特別に聞かせてあげましょう。@k@vS02/11/130700229.…じゃあ最初の事件から行きます？」
TextENG: ``...Well, all right then.@k@vS02/11/130700228. They're officially secret investigations, and we're under a media blackout, but I'll let you in on them.@k@vS02/11/130700229. ...Then shall we start from the first incident?``

TextJPN: …綿流しの晩の、富竹さんと鷹野さんの怪死。
TextENG: ...The freak deaths of Tomitake-san and Takano-san on the night of Watanagashi.

TextJPN: 「……こっちはお恥ずかしいかな、…さっぱり進展なしです」
TextENG: ``......On this one, embarrassingly enough... we haven't made any progress at all.``

TextJPN: 「まずは富竹さん。@k@vS02/11/130700232.集団で暴行を受けた形跡はあるのですが、自分の喉を掻き破るなんて異常な死に方の説明がつかないんです。@k@vS02/11/130700233.…なんらかの薬物中毒を疑っているんですが検出はされませんでした」
TextENG: ``First of all, Tomitake-san.@k@vS02/11/130700232. There are indications on his body that he was assaulted by a group of people, but we have no explanation for him clawing out his own throat and dying.@k@vS02/11/130700233. ...We suspect an overdose from a stimulant or something, but we didn't detect anything.``

TextJPN: 「鷹野さんはどんな感じなんです…？」
TextENG: ``What about Takano-san...?``

TextJPN: 「同じくさっぱりです。@k@vS02/11/130700235.焼死死体は検死が非常～に困難でして。@k@vS02/11/130700236.首を絞められた後にガソリンをかけられたんじゃないかと見ています」
TextENG: ``The same—we're in the dark.@k@vS02/11/130700235. Autopsies for those who are burned to death are reeeeal tough.@k@vS02/11/130700236. We believe she was doused in gasoline after she was strangled.``

TextJPN: 「…管轄がおとなりの県警さんでね。@k@vS02/11/130700238.あちらさん、自分たちの縄張りの事件だからって、あんまり協力的じゃないんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700239.…おっと、これは関係ない話ですね」
TextENG: ``...That one falls under the neighbouring Prefecture's police department.@k@vS02/11/130700238. They haven't been very cooperative, even though it happened in our territory.@k@vS02/11/130700239. ...Oh, that's not really relevant, though.``

TextJPN: ……不可解な死だという以上のことは、何もわかっていないということか。
TextENG: ...So the police didn't know anything other than the fact that the victims died inexplicably.

TextJPN: 「ですが、犯行時間は概ね、お祭りが終わった直後だろうと見ています。@k@vS02/11/130700241.……鷹野さんの方はちょっとあやふやですが、富竹さんとほぼ同じ時刻に殺害され、山中に遺棄されたと考えるのが妥当でしょうなぁ」
TextENG: ``Nonetheless, the times when the incidents occurred have been generally placed right after the festival ended.@k@vS02/11/130700241. ...It's a bit uncertain in Takano-san's case, but the likely prospect is that she was murdered at about the same time as Tomitake-san, then dumped in the mountains.``

TextJPN: 「……どうして、わざわざ遠くの山まで死体を運んだんでしょう。@k@vS02/01/130100821.…富竹さんも同じように遠くへ運べばよかったのに…」
TextENG: ``...Why would they bring a dead body all the way to the mountains?@k@vS02/01/130100821. ...They should have just brought Tomitake-san out there too...``

TextJPN: 「ありゃ、…前原さん、あなた、なかなかどうして鋭いですねぇ！@k@vS02/11/130700243.　もちろん私もそこは注目すべき点だと思ってますよ。@k@vS02/11/130700244.…他にもいくつか不審点はありますが、…まぁ現時点でお話できるのはこのくらいです」
TextENG: ``Oh my... Maebara-san, you're quite sharp, you know that?@k@vS02/11/130700243. Of course, I do believe that is something we need to be attentive of.@k@vS02/11/130700244. ...There are a bunch of other suspicious things... but this is about all I can tell you at this point.``

TextJPN: 「……村長さんの方はどうですか？@k@vS02/01/130100823.　何か手がかりはありましたか？」
TextENG: ``...How about the mayor?@k@vS02/01/130100823. Have there been any clues?``

TextJPN: 話題が尽きると、次は自分にお鉢が回ってくるかもしれないと思い、次の話題を向ける…。
TextENG: Having exhausted that topic, I changed the subject... otherwise, he might turn the conversation on me...

TextJPN: 「失踪された一日の足取りを調べました。@k@vS02/11/130700246.…手がかりになるようなものは見つかりませんでしたが、一応、お話しましょうか」
TextENG: ``We investigated his movements on the day he disappeared.@k@vS02/11/130700246. ...We didn't find anything that could provide any clues, but I'll tell you about it anyway.``

TextJPN: 村長、公由喜一郎。
TextENG: The mayor—Kiichirou Kimiyoshi.

TextJPN: …彼は重度の痔を患っていたという。
TextENG: ...Apparently he was suffering from severe hemorrhoids.

TextJPN: 「古い生まれの方って非常にプライドが高いんですよね。@k@vS02/11/130700248.…それで村長さん、誰にも内緒で鹿骨市内にある大学病院の肛門科に通われていたんです」
TextENG: ``People who've lived a long time have an unusual amount of pride.@k@vS02/11/130700248. ...So the mayor hadn't been telling anyone that he was going to a proctologist at a certain university hospital in Shishibone.

TextJPN: 「失踪当日、村長さんは診察の予約が取ってあったんで朝一で出掛けられました」
TextENG: On the day he disappeared, he had an appointment for a checkup, so he went out first thing in the morning.``

TextJPN: 大学病院みたいな大きい病院は、待ち時間がとても長いことは俺だって知ってる。
TextENG: Even I knew that big hospitals, like university hospitals, had a really long waiting time.

TextJPN: …予約があっても何時間も前から順番待ちをするのは当り前らしい。
TextENG: ...Apparently people would get in line hours beforehand, even if they had an appointment.

TextJPN: 「診察が終わったのは午後１時頃です。@k@vS02/11/130700251.その後、病院内のレストランで軽食を取られ、雑誌を読みながら時間をつぶされました。@k@vS02/11/130700252.…このあたりのことは自宅にあったお財布の中のレシートでわかってます」
TextENG: ``His exam ended at 1 PM.@k@vS02/11/130700251. After that, he ate a light meal in the hospital restaurant and passed the time reading a magazine.@k@vS02/11/130700252. ...We know this because of a receipt we found in his wallet at his house.``

TextJPN: ……不審な点はまったくない。
TextENG: ...There was nothing suspicious at all about that.

TextJPN: 「その日は夕方から神社の集会所で会合の予定があったんです」
TextENG: ``That day, he had planned to go to a meeting in the assembly hall in the evening.``

TextJPN: 「…それで余裕を持ってお帰りになるはずだったんですが、途中、電車で人身事故がありましてね。@k@vS02/11/130700255.どうも、それで足止めを食ってしまったらしく、家についたのは会合の時間の直前でした」
TextENG: ``...He was supposed to return home with plenty of time to spare, but while he was on the train coming back, there was an accident.@k@vS02/11/130700255. Seems it delayed him a bit, and he only got back to his house right before the meeting was scheduled to start.``

TextJPN: 「ご家族が、大慌てで神社の集会所に出掛けていく村長さんを目撃しています」
TextENG: His family witnessed a very hectic mayor leaving to go to the assembly hall at the shrine.``

TextJPN: 「…会合ってのは何だったんですか。@k@vS02/01/130100824_1.確か、その会合の帰り道に失踪してるんですよね」
TextENG: ``...What was the meeting about?@k@vS02/01/130100824_1. He disappeared on his way back home, right?``

TextJPN: 「会合は御三家と町会の主要役員が集まってのものでした。@k@vS02/11/130700259.今年も起こってしまった連続怪死事件の対応について協議したものと思われます」
TextENG: ``The Three Families and the essential members of the town assembly were at the meeting.@k@vS02/11/130700259. We think they were discussing how to deal with the serial freak death incidents that had happened again this year.``

TextJPN: ……それで……その帰り道に………。
TextENG: ...So then... on his way home......

TextJPN: 詩音を可愛がってくれた爺さん。
TextENG: The old man, who had treated Shion like his own daughter.

TextJPN: …不安に押しつぶされそうな詩音を励ましてくれた、頼もしい人だったろうに。
TextENG: ...He was a dependable person who would encourage Shion whenever she felt pressured by anxiety, and yet...

TextJPN: ……詩音の痛ましい声が胸に刺さる…。
TextENG: ...Shion's painful voice struck me right in the heart...

TextJPN: 「どうなさいました？」
TextENG: ``What's the matter?``

TextJPN: 自分で、自分の出した素っ頓狂な声に驚いた。@k……今、俺は、…何に驚いたんだ…？
TextENG: I was taken aback by how strange my own voice sounded.@k ...What was it that just... surprised me...?

TextJPN: 今、一瞬気がついたことを頭からもう一度引き出すため、両手で頭を締め付ける。
TextENG: I squeezed my head with my hands to try and drag back out what I had only realized for a split second.

TextJPN: ……思い出せ前原圭一！！
TextENG: ...Remember, Keiichi Maebara!!

TextJPN: 今、気付いたじゃないか！！@k　…大切なこと…！！！
TextENG: You just realized something!!@k ...Something important...!!!

TextJPN: 綿流しの晩。
TextENG: The night of Watanagashi.

TextJPN: これが全ての始まり。
TextENG: That was when everything started.

TextJPN: …その夜、鷹野さんたちが死んだ。
TextENG: ...That night, Takano-san and Tomitake-san died.

TextJPN: ……翌朝、事件が雛見沢中に広がった。
TextENG: ...The next morning, word of the incident had spread throughout Hinamizawa.

TextJPN: 夕方からの会合でそれを話し合うことになった。
TextENG: They planned to talk about it during the evening meeting.

TextJPN: だが村長さんは病院に予約があったので、予定通り、家族にも内緒の病院へ向かった。
TextENG: The mayor, however, had an appointment at the hospital, and as planned, he went there without telling his family.

TextJPN: 病院で診察を受け、@k@|@y食事をし、@k@|@y帰りの電車で思わぬ足止めを受け。
TextENG: He got a checkup at the hospital,@k@|@y ate something,@k@|@y and then there was an unexpected delay on his train ride back.

TextJPN: …帰宅した時にはもう会合の始まる時間だった。
TextENG: ...When he returned, the meeting was already about to start.

TextJPN: 村長さんは上着を着替え、自転車にまたがり、大急ぎで神社の集会所に走っていった…。
TextENG: The mayor changed clothes, got on his bicycle, and hurried to the assembly hall at the shrine as fast as he could...

TextJPN: 綿流しの晩の事件が耳に入ってから、…集会所に姿を現すまで。@k……村長さんの一日の行動は全て秘密だったことになる。
TextENG: From when he heard about the incident on the night of Watanagashi... until when he showed up at the assembly hall.@k ......Everything he was doing that day was done in secret.

TextJPN: その間は誰にも知られることなく、@k@|@yひとりで病院で過ごし、@k@|@yひとりで食事をし、@k@|@yひとりで電車に乗ってきた。
TextENG: During that time, nobody found out that...@k@|@y he went to the hospital alone,@k@|@y he ate alone,@k@|@y and he got on the train alone.

TextJPN: ……それは外部から一切接触できなかったことを示す。
TextENG: ...That all meant he had absolutely no contact with anyone else.

TextJPN: 電話ですら呼び出せない状態だった。
TextENG: You couldn't have even called him on the phone.

TextJPN: ……でもそれが何だってんだ前原圭一…。@k@rそれがどうしたって言うんだ前原圭一…。
TextENG: ...Okay, but what does that mean, Keiichi Maebara...?@k@rWhy does that matter, Keiichi Maebara...?
``...What's wrong?@k@vS02/01/130100594. ...Tell me.@k@vS02/01/130100595. We're not keeping secrets from each other, right...?``

TextJPN: 「私、…………公由のお爺ちゃんに……打ち明けたんです」
TextENG: ``I............ Old man Kimiyoshi, I... I told him everything.``

TextJPN: 打チ明ケタンデス。@k公由ノオ爺チャンニ。
TextENG: I told him everything.@k I told old man Kimiyoshi everything.

TextJPN: 「……村長さんに、……私、あの晩、祭具殿に忍び込んだこと……打ち明けたんです。@k@vS02/06/130600463.…誰かにそれを見られてて、……私たちを狙っている人がいるって」
TextENG: ``...That night... I told the mayor... that we snuck into the ritual storehouse.@k@vS02/06/130600463. ...Also that someone saw us... and was out to get us.``

TextJPN: 「……公由のお爺ちゃん、…怒らなかった」
TextENG: ``...Old man Kimiyoshi... didn't get angry.``

TextJPN: 「……そして、にっこり笑って、詩音ちゃんがちゃんと反省してるなら、鬼隠しになんかなるものか、…って。@k@vS02/06/130600466.…本当に……笑いながら……任せなさい…って………。……ぅぅ…ッ！！」
TextENG: ``......He smiled, then told me that if I was properly sorry about it, there was no way I'd be demoned away...@k@vS02/06/130600466. ...He was really... smiling... and he told me to leave it to... him...... ...ngh...!!``

TextJPN: 全身に、玉のように汗が浮き出ていた。
TextENG: Sweat burst out of my body like bullets.

TextJPN: ……それらが一筋の汗となって、……つーっと…額から鼻筋へ、……伝い落ちていく。
TextENG: ...They became one long strand... and slid down... down from my forehead to my nose...... and fell.

TextJPN: ………だからつまり、………何だってんだ……？
TextENG: ......So then... What does it mean...?

TextJPN: おい、…もうとぼけるのはよせよ前原圭一…………。
TextENG: Hey, Keiichi Maebara... No more playing dumb.........

TextJPN: イツ、打チ明ケルンダ？
TextENG: When did she tell him?

TextJPN: 詩音は事件を知ったのを、@r朝、父親がしていた電話で聞いたと言った。
TextENG: Shion said she learned of the incident from a phone call her father had made that morning.

TextJPN: その頃、村長は病院の予約があったから朝一で家を出ていた。
TextENG: The mayor had left the house first thing in the morning for his appointment at the hospital.

TextJPN: 行き先は誰にも告げてない。
TextENG: He didn't tell anybody where he was going.

TextJPN: ……村長が大学病院へ行ったのは、誰も知らないことだ。
TextENG: ...Nobody knew about him going to the university hospital.

TextJPN: そして電車の事故で帰宅が遅れ、@r帰ってきたらすぐに集会所に飛び出して行った。
TextENG: Furthermore... his train ride back to his house was delayed by an accident—as soon as he got home, he rushed out to the assembly hall.

TextJPN: そして集会所で会合が始まり、…それは暗くなるまで続いた。
TextENG: Then the meeting at the assembly hall began... ...and continued until it was dark out.

TextJPN: …そして解散。
TextENG: ...Then, everyone left.

TextJPN: …解散のあとは、もう目撃はない。@k…失踪するのみ。
TextENG: ...Nobody saw him after the meeting was over.@k ...He just disappeared.

TextJPN: つまり、…つまり、……つまり、………………えぇと………。
TextENG: Which meant... ...Which meant... ......Which meant... ............Umm......

TextJPN: 「前原さん？@k@vS02/11/130700262.　大丈夫ですか？@k@vS02/11/130700263.　やっぱり暑いならクーラー入れますよ？」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san?@k@vS02/11/130700262. Are you all right?@k@vS02/11/130700263. If you're too hot, I can turn on the air conditioner, mm?``

TextJPN: その先を考えることを、もうひとりの自分がやめろと脳を撹乱させる。
TextENG: Another part of me was messing with my thoughts, demanding that I didn't think any further than that.

TextJPN: 頭がカタカタと痙攣し…中に詰まったジュースを、わけわからなく…めちゃくちゃになるようにミキサーをかける。
TextENG: My head was pounding violently... and the fluids packed inside it... all blended together until nothing made sense.

TextJPN: やっと沈殿しかけたそれは、あっというまに粉々にぐちゃぐちゃになって形をなさなくなった…。
TextENG: It was just about to settle, yet it had been smashed and melted in the blink of an eye, no longer able to retain its shape...
``...Maebara-san?@k@vS02/11/130700265. Are you in there?``

TextJPN: 大石さんは何本目かのタバコに火をつける。
TextENG: Ooishi-san lit yet another cigarette.

TextJPN: …吸殻入れにはもう何本もの吸殻が詰まっていた。
TextENG: ...There was yet another cigarette butt placed in the ashtray.

TextJPN: ……それは時間の経過を示すものなのか。
TextENG: ...Was it displaying the passage of time?

TextJPN: …俺は、…そんなにも長い時間、思考を凍らせていたのか………。
TextENG: ...Had I... had my thoughts been frozen over for that long...?

TextJPN: 「私、知ってる限りのことを話したつもりです。@k@vS02/11/130700267.…お返しに、今度は前原さんの話を聞かせてもらってもいいですよね」
TextENG: ``I've tried to tell you everything I know.@k@vS02/11/130700267. ...In return, feel free to tell me anything you want, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 俺の頭の中は…もう、ぐちゃぐちゃのジュースになっていた。
TextENG: My mind had become... a gigantic, oozing mess.

TextJPN: …脳みそだったものはミキサーの刃ですっかり摩り下ろされてしまっていて、……何も考えることなんてできない。
TextENG: ...My brain felt like it had been totally minced by the blades of a blender...... and I couldn't think.

TextJPN: 「ほらほら、また黙り込む。@k@vS02/11/130700269.…もし誤解があるようなら先に解いておきたいんですがね。@k@vS02/11/130700270.…私ゃ別に、あなたが犯人だなんて思っちゃいないんです」
TextENG: ``Now, now, don't clam up again.@k@vS02/11/130700269. ...If there are any misunderstandings, I'd like to clear them up first.@k@vS02/11/130700270. ...I don't think you're the culprit here or anything.``

TextJPN: 大石さんは、本人なりの精一杯のスマイルをして見せた。
TextENG: Ooishi-san gave his best attempt at an adult smile.

TextJPN: 「…あの晩、あなたたち４人が祭具殿に忍び込んだことは知っています。@k@vS02/11/130700272.次の日にはもう村の、知る人は誰でも知る噂になってましたからね」
TextENG: ``...I know the four of you snuck into the ritual storehouse that night.@k@vS02/11/130700272. Everyone in the village heard rumors about it by the next day.

TextJPN: 「…それ自体は不法侵入として問われるべきことですが、問題はそれじゃない。@k@vS02/11/130700274.……そこで何があったかなんです。@k@vS02/11/130700275.…忍び込んだ人間が次々と犠牲になるような、何があったのか」
TextENG: ...That in itself means we should take you in for trespassing, but that isn't the problem.@k@vS02/11/130700274. ......It's what was inside.@k@vS02/11/130700275. ...What was inside that made the people who snuck in there end up as sacrifices?``

TextJPN: 「……………何も、……なかったです」
TextENG: ``............There... ......There wasn't anything.``

TextJPN: 言ってしまってから、認めたことを後悔したが、…もう今さらだと思った。
TextENG: As soon as I said it, I regretted confirming my presence there... but I knew it didn't matter anymore.

TextJPN: 「…本当に何もなかったんですか？」
TextENG: ``...Was there really nothing in there?

TextJPN: 「だって、現にこうして中に入った人たちが次々と犠牲になってるんですよ？@k@vS02/11/130700278.　しかも、扉のカギを付け替えた村長や梨花さんまで犠牲に。@k@vS02/11/130700279.…それだけの事態を引き起こす、何があの中にあったんです？」
TextENG: I mean, everyone who went in is being sacrificed one by one, you know?@k@vS02/11/130700278. Even the mayor and Rika-san, who switched the lock on the door, were sacrificed.@k@vS02/11/130700279. ...What was inside that could have caused such terrible things to happen?``

TextJPN: もう黙っているのにも疲れ果てた…。
TextENG: I was far too tired of keeping quiet about this...

TextJPN: …これこそが大石の狙いなのだろうが、…もう今さらどうでもよかった。
TextENG: ...Perhaps that was Ooishi-san's goal all along... but again, that didn't matter anymore.

TextJPN: 「………大昔に使った拷問道具がたくさんしまってありました。@k@vS02/01/130100838.…それを鷹野さんたちと見て回りました」
TextENG: ``...There were just a lot of torture devices that were used a long time ago.@k@vS02/01/130100838. ...I looked around at them with everyone.``

TextJPN: 「本当にそれだけ？」
TextENG: ``Was that really all?``

TextJPN: 「…本当にそれだけです」
TextENG: ``...That was really all.``

TextJPN: 「口封じをされるような、とんでもない物が隠してあったんじゃないですか？」
TextENG: ``There was nothing terrible in there that would make you keep silent?``

TextJPN: 「不審な木箱やコンテナが山積みされてませんでしたか？」
TextENG: ``There weren't any suspicious wooden boxes or containers packed in there?``

TextJPN: 大石さんが期待するような、…そんな大仰なものは一切なかったが。
TextENG: There was nothing... as exaggerated as what Ooishi-san was hoping for, but...

TextJPN: ……ある意味、充分にとんでもない物が隠してあったと思う。
TextENG: ...I felt like in a way, there were plenty of terrible things hidden in there.

TextJPN: それに、祭具殿を神聖だと思う側の人間から見れば、…俺が見て大した物だと思おうが思うまいが、どうでもいいことに違いない。
TextENG: From the perspective of someone who viewed the storehouse as sacred... whether or not I thought I had seen some crazy things didn't matter in the slightest.

TextJPN: ……あの４人は禁忌を破った。@k罰せよ。@k………そうなるはずだ。
TextENG: ......The four of us broke the taboo.@k Punish us.@k .........That should have been what happened.

TextJPN: 「…あの祭具殿に、何か秘密があるんじゃないかと思って、捜査令状を請求したんですがね、@k@vS02/11/130700287.……もーー、空前絶後の妨害工作がありまして」
TextENG: ``...We put in a request for a search warrant thinking that there might have been some secrets hidden in that storehouse.@k@vS02/11/130700287. ...Agh, it's been the sabotage of the century.``

TextJPN: 「信仰の対象に対する侮辱であり、憲法で定めた信仰の自由を何たらかんたら…。@k@vS02/11/130700289.いやぁもう！@k@vS02/11/130700290.　…だから実際に入ったあなたに聞くほかなかったんですよ」
TextENG: ``They said it would be an insult to religious figures, and something about the right to free religion in the constitution...@k@vS02/11/130700289. Ahh, geez!@k@vS02/11/130700290. ...That's why I really didn't have any other recourse but to ask you, since you went in there.``

TextJPN: 「……本当に、…古い、錆びて埃を被った拷問道具しかなかったです。@k@vS02/01/130100841.……他に目立つものなんて何もなかったです」
TextENG: ``......There really was just... old, rusty, dusty torture equipment.@k@vS02/01/130100841. ...Nothing else stood out.``

TextJPN: 「…ふ～む。@k@vS02/11/130700292.……では、富竹さんたちが殺されたのは、禁忌を破ったからという、制裁だけなんですかね？」
TextENG: ``...Hmm.@k@vS02/11/130700292. ......Then Tomitake-san and Takano-san were only killed as a punishment for having broken the taboo?``

TextJPN: ……だけなんですかね、なんて言われたら返事のしようがない。
TextENG: ...I didn't have an answer for the 'only' part.

TextJPN: 「……もういちいち隠しませんけどね。@k@vS02/11/130700294.…あなただけが今日まで被害を免れてるんです」
TextENG: ``...I suppose I won't bother hiding it anymore.@k@vS02/11/130700294. ...You're the only one to escape harm so far.``

TextJPN: 「あなた以外は全員が消えたのに、あなただけが無事なんです」
TextENG: ``Everyone but you has disappeared, and yet you alone are safe.``

TextJPN: 「…あなたが無事で、あなた以外が被害に遭う、どんな違いがあったのか？@k@vS02/11/130700297.　それが知りたいんです」
TextENG: ``...What's the difference between you and them that would protect you, but bring harm to the others?@k@vS02/11/130700297. That's what I want to know.``

TextJPN: …大石さんの言い方にどこか違和感がある。
TextENG: ...There was something wrong with what Ooishi-san was saying.

TextJPN: …あなただけが、@kあなただけが。@k…何だって…？
TextENG: ...You alone...@k You alone.@k ...What...?

TextJPN: 「ちょ、…ちょっと待ってください。@k@vS02/01/130100843.あなただけがって、…どういう意味ですか？」
TextENG: ``Wait... Wait a second.@k@vS02/01/130100843. What do you mean by... 'you alone'?``

TextJPN: 「なははは、…ですから、あなただけが、最後の生き残りなんじゃないですか」
TextENG: ``Na-ha-ha-ha. ...I'm saying, that you alone have been left alive, right?``

TextJPN: 「祭具殿に忍び込んだコソ泥４人組の」
TextENG: ``Out of the four people who tiptoed into the storehouse for ritual implements, I mean.``

TextJPN: ………最後の生き残り？
TextENG: ...The only one left alive?

TextJPN: …ちょっと待って、…まだ詩音が…、
TextENG: ...Hold on. ...Shion was still...

TextJPN: 「あの晩に、富竹ジロウさんと鷹野三四さんが死に、翌日、園崎詩音さんが失踪しました。@k@vS02/11/130700301.…あなただけが、無事に今日までを過ごしてるんです。@k@vS02/11/130700302.…なぜあなただけなのか？@k@vS02/11/130700303.　私はそれが知りたいと言ってるんです」
TextENG: ``Jirou Tomitake-san and Miyo Takano-san died that night, and Shion Sonozaki disappeared the next day.@k@vS02/11/130700301. ...Only you are still safe and sound at this point.@k@vS02/11/130700302. ...Why only you?@k@vS02/11/130700303. I'm saying that's what I want to know.``

TextJPN: 「し、詩音が失踪したって？！@k@vS02/01/130100845.　そんな馬鹿なッ！！！」
TextENG: ``S-Shion disappeared?!@k@vS02/01/130100845. That's impossible!!!``

TextJPN: 思わず声を荒げてしまう。@k…でもそんなことはどうでもよかった。
TextENG: I unintentionally raised my voice...@k ...but I didn't care about that.

TextJPN: 富竹さんが死に、@k鷹野さんが死に、@k@|@y…詩音が消えた？！
TextENG: Tomitake-san died,@k Takano-san died,@k@|@y ...and Shion disappeared?!

TextJPN: いつ消えたって…？！？！
TextENG: When did she disappear...?!?!

TextJPN: この男は、何の話をしているんだッ？！？！
TextENG: What is this guy talking about?!?!

TextJPN: 「…ありゃ、……とっくにご存じだったとばかり」
TextENG: ``...Oh, well now... I thought you were long since aware of this.``

TextJPN: 「…そ、そんなのは初めて聞いたッ！@k@vS02/01/130100847.　詩音が失踪した？　いつッ！！！」
TextENG: ``...Th-This is the first I've heard of it!@k@vS02/01/130100847. Shion disappeared? When?!?``

TextJPN: 「えー、遡ると綿流しの次の日に失踪していたことになります」
TextENG: ``Well, going back a bit, she disappeared the day after Watanagashi.``

TextJPN: …遡ると、だって？！@k　わけのわからない言い方を…！！
TextENG: ...Going back a bit?!@k Stop saying stuff I don't understand...!!

TextJPN: 「園崎詩音さんは、その日の気分で親類の家を泊まり歩いたりしますので、所在不明が当り前なんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700307.学校も気分ひとつでよく休みますしね。@k@vS02/11/130700308.先生も困り果ててました」
TextENG: ``Shion Sonozaki spends the night at relatives' houses depending on her mood on any given day, so no one thought much of not knowing where she was.@k@vS02/11/130700307. She frequently takes days off from school, too.@k@vS02/11/130700308. Her teacher has been pretty troubled by it.``

TextJPN: 「そんなことは聞いてないッ！！@k@vS02/01/130100849.　詩音はいつ失踪したかって聞いてるんだ！！」
TextENG: ``I didn't ask about any of that!!@k@vS02/01/130100849. I'm asking you when Shion disappeared!!``

TextJPN: 「ですから、綿流しの次の日です」
TextENG: ``I told you, it was the day after Watanagashi.``

TextJPN: …全身の体液が逆流していく…。
TextENG: ...The fluids in my body all reversed direction...

TextJPN: …平衡感覚がなくなり、…視界の全てのものがぐにゃりと歪み出す。
TextENG: ...I lost my sense of balance... and everything I could see started to warp and twist out of shape.

TextJPN: ……とても自分を保っていられなかった…。
TextENG: ...I simply couldn't endure it...

TextJPN: ちょっと待て、ちょっと待て。
TextENG: Hang on, hang on.

TextJPN: ……詩音がもう失踪してたって…？
TextENG: ......Shion had already disappeared...?

TextJPN: じゃあじゃあ……、@k@s0.@a0.俺ニ毎晩、掛カッテキタ、アノ電話ハ、…誰ガ掛ケテタンダヨ…。
TextENG: Then, then...@k@s0.@a0.That night, that call, that phone call... Who was that...?

TextJPN: 毎晩かけてくれた。
TextENG: She called me every night.

TextJPN: 励ましてくれた。
TextENG: She encouraged me.

TextJPN: …消されてなるものかって、二人で頑張って生き抜こうと誓い合った。
TextENG: ...We vowed that we would do our best to live on and not be erased.

TextJPN: ……そう、あれは詩音からの電話のはず、詩音からの電話のはず、詩音からの電話のはず…。
TextENG: ...Yes, that should have been a phone call with Shion, should have been a phone call with Shion, should have been a phone call with Shion...

TextJPN: 「学校は平気で休むし、それを自宅に知らせても取り合ってもらえないから、学校もいちいち電話しない。@k@vS02/11/130700311.…そんなこんなで、彼女が失踪したことに気付くのにだいぶ時間がかかったんですよ」
TextENG: ``She took breaks from class like it was nothing, and her family wouldn't listen when the school told them, so they mostly don't bother calling anymore.@k@vS02/11/130700311. ...So it ended up taking quite a while before we realized she'd disappeared.``

TextJPN: 全身の毛穴に針を突き立てたような刺激痛。
TextENG: I felt a stabbing pain like needles were being pushed into every pore of my body.

TextJPN: ……それが背中から始まり、…全身に広がっていく。
TextENG: ...It started on my back... and began spreading throughout the rest of me.

TextJPN: …それは皮膚の表面を全て覆い尽くすと、…今度はお腹の内側にも広がっていった……。
TextENG: ...When it had completely covered the surface of my skin... it began to worm its way inside my stomach as well......

TextJPN: 「ほら、覚えてませんか？@k@vS02/11/130700313.　綿流しの次の日に、私たち図書館でお会いしたでしょう」
TextENG: ``Don't you remember?@k@vS02/11/130700313. We talked at the library the day after Watanagashi.``

TextJPN: 「あの時、詩音さんも居ましたよね。@k@vS02/11/130700315.…あれが最後の目撃なんです。@k@vS02/11/130700316.あの後、彼女の所在は確認されてないんです」
TextENG: ``Shion-san was there then.@k@vS02/11/130700315. ...That was the last we saw of her.@k@vS02/11/130700316. No one knows where she's been since.``

TextJPN: あの日は、俺だけ大石さんに捕まって、…詩音はバイトを口実にひょうひょうと逃げた。
TextENG: That day, Ooishi-san had only caught me... and Shion bounded away, lying that she needed to go to work.

TextJPN: ……そして夜、電話をかけてきてくれたじゃないか…！
TextENG: ...Didn't she call me that night...?!

TextJPN: 「エンジェルモートっていうファミレスのバイトですよね。@k@vS02/11/130700318.あの日から無断欠勤です。@k@vS02/11/130700319.…今日に至るまで全てを無断欠勤しているんです。@k@vS02/11/130700320.お店の人も連絡を取ろうにも取れず、困りきってましたよ」
TextENG: ``Her job was at a restaurant called Angel Mort, right?@k@vS02/11/130700318. She hasn't been there since that day.@k@vS02/11/130700319. ...She's been completely absent ever since.@k@vS02/11/130700320. The person at the restaurant couldn't get in touch with her. He was really worried.``

TextJPN: 「状況証拠だけですがね。@k@vS02/11/130700322.図書館でお別れしてから、バイト先に向かうまで。@k@vS02/11/130700323.…この間に失踪したと考えるのが妥当でしょうね」
TextENG: ``It's only circumstantial evidence, but...@k@vS02/11/130700322. after she left us at the library, but before she made it to work...@k@vS02/11/130700323. I think it's appropriate to consider her having disappeared during that time.``

TextJPN: ……詩音が、……俺を置いて逃げ出した、…直後…？！
TextENG: ...Right after Shion... ran away without me...?!

TextJPN: 「ご存じなかったみたいですね。@k@vS02/11/130700325.…なら、先に話せばもっと話が早かったかなぁ。@k@vS02/11/130700326.もうこれでご理解いただけたでしょ。@k@vS02/11/130700327.…あとはあなただけなんです。@k@vS02/11/130700328.あなただけが、祭具殿に忍び込んだ４人の生き残りなんです」
TextENG: ``It seems that you didn't know.@k@vS02/11/130700325. ...Maybe if you had said something earlier, this would have gone more quickly.@k@vS02/11/130700326. Now you understand, right?@k@vS02/11/130700327. ...You're the only one left.@k@vS02/11/130700328. You're the only survivor of the four who slipped into the ritual storehouse.``

TextJPN: ………そんな馬鹿な…。@k…………そんな馬鹿な……。
TextENG: ......It couldn't be...@k .........It just couldn't be...

TextJPN: 「次に何か起こるとすれば、それはあなたなんです。@k@vS02/11/130700330.前原さん、どうかご理解を」
TextENG: ``If something else happens, it would happen to you.@k@vS02/11/130700330. I need you to understand that, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: ……そんな馬鹿な、@kそんな馬鹿な、@kそんな馬鹿な…。
TextENG: ...It can't be,@k it can't be,@k it can't be...

TextJPN: …詩音がもう、すでに、失踪してたって…？！？！
TextENG: ...Shion had already disappeared...?!?!

TextJPN: そんなはずはない、そんなはずはない。
TextENG: That couldn't be. It couldn't be.

TextJPN: …詩音とは一昨日も電話した。
TextENG: ...I talked to her the day before yesterday.

TextJPN: 昨夜も電話した。
TextENG: I talked to her last night.

TextJPN: そして今夜も掛かってくるはず。
TextENG: She was going to call me again today.

TextJPN: それは詩音の電話、詩音の電話。@k…詩音から詩音から。
TextENG: That was Shion on the phone—Shion on the phone.@k ...It was from Shion, from Shion.

TextJPN: 「詩音さんはとっくに失踪してるんです。@k@vS02/11/130700332.…次は、あなたなんですよ」
TextENG: ``Shion has long since disappeared.@k@vS02/11/130700332. ...Next will be you.``

TextJPN: じゃあ…夜毎に掛かってきた電話は誰からなんだ。
TextENG: Then... who was on the phone those past nights?

TextJPN: 夜毎に掛かってきた電話は誰からなんだ。
TextENG: Who was on the phone those past nights?

TextJPN: 夜毎に掛かってきた電話は誰からなんだ…！！！
TextENG: Who was on the phone those past nights...!!?

TextJPN: 「そんな、………馬鹿なあぁあぁああぁあぁぁあぁあぁああぁあぁぁあぁあぁああぁあぁぁああぁあッ！！！」
TextENG: ``That's... It can't beeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!``
